summary: This is an email chain from June 12, 2019, between Assistant U.S. Attorneys in the Southern District of New York discussing a FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein. They are trying to coordinate internally after learning second-hand that their civil division is processing a FOIA request from a news outlet, and they want to ensure materials from the covert criminal investigation are not inadvertently disclosed.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The author of the initial email inquiring about a FOIA case relating to the Epstein investigation, expressing concern about cross-communication and potential disclosure of materials from the covert criminal case.

events.title: Internal discussion about Epstein FOIA case
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys in SDNY exchange emails to discuss a FOIA case brought by a news outlet regarding Jeffrey Epstein, seeking to coordinate with the civil division to prevent disclosure of materials from the criminal investigation.

keyFacts: A FOIA case related to Jeffrey Epstein was pending in the Southern District of New York, brought by a news outlet.
The criminal investigation into Epstein was described as covert and not widely known even among assistant U.S. attorneys at the time.
The civil division was on a three-year document production schedule, producing about 500 documents per month for the FOIA case.
There was concern about ensuring materials from the criminal case file were not disclosed through the FOIA process.
The email chain reveals internal coordination efforts between criminal and civil divisions of the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the Epstein case.
